description: a(n) is the starting position of the first occurrence of a string of exactly n 0's in the decimal expansion of Pi.
references: Shigeru Kondo, calculation of Pi to 12.8 * 10^9 digits, using the program PiFast of Xavier Gourdon
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pi Digits
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: More terms from Colin B Martin (martinc(AT)ram.net.au), Nov 25 2001
Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_ at the suggestion of _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 24 2007
